sen.e: "Karukuchi" is an old name of Kamigata rakugo, traditional Japanese comic storytelling as performed in the Kyoto-Osaka region.
"Karukuchi" is an old name of Kamigata rakugo, traditional Japanese comic storytelling as performed in the Kyoto-Osaka region.
"Karukuchi" is an old name of Kamigata rakugo, traditional Japanese comic storytelling as performed in the Kyoto-Osaka region.

sen.j: 主に2人組で披露される話芸の一種。
sen.e: It is a type of narrative arts, which is typically performed by a pair.
It is a type of narrative arts, which is typically performed by a pair.
It is a type of narrative arts, which is typically performed by a pair.
Details are described in the main section.
Details are described in the main section.
Details are described in the main section.

sen.j: 軽口（かるくし）は、主に2人組で披露される話芸の一種。
sen.e: Karukuchi is a type of narrative arts, which is typically performed by a pair of people.
sen.cmt: 原文「かるくし」の「し」は「ち」としてスペルしました
sen.e: Karukuchi is a type of narrative arts, which is typically performed by a pair of people.
Karukuchi is a type of narrative arts, which is typically performed by a pair of people.

sen.j: 別称は「掛合噺」「掛合茶番」等
sen.e: It is also called as "kakeai-banashi" or "kakeai-chaban".
It is also called as "kakeai-banashi" or "kakeai-chaban".
It is also called as "kakeai-banashi" or "kakeai-chaban".

sen.j: 漫才や喜劇の源流といわれる。
sen.e: Karukuchi is said to be the origin of "manzai" or comic dialogue and comedies.
Karukuchi is said to be the origin of "manzai" or a comic dialogue and comedies.
Karukuchi is said to be the origin of "manzai" or a comic dialogue and comedies.

sen.j: 江戸時代末期に京都四条河原町、大坂天満宮の神社の境内に舞台を設けひとりでに歌舞伎、芝居の物真似演じられた起源。
sen.e: Karukuchi has its origin in plays such as kabuki parodied and developed on a stage prepared in the precincts of Osakatenmangu Shrine, in Shijo Kawaramachi, Kyoto City at the end of the Edo Period.

Karukuchi has its origin in plays such as kabuki parodied and developed on a stage prepared in the precincts of the Osaka-tenmangu Shrine, in Shijo Kawaramachi, Kyoto City at the end of the Edo Period.

Karukuchi has its origin in plays such as kabuki parodied and developed on a stage prepared in the precincts of the Osaka-tenmangu Shrine, in Shijo Kawaramachi, Kyoto City at the end of the Edo Period.

sen.j: その後舞台芸になり寄席で俄の開幕（前座）として演じられた。
sen.e: Gradually, these entertainments evolved into theatrical arts which were performed as a type of impromptu comic plays (called "niwaka") as opening acts (called "zenza") at vaudeville theaters.
Gradually, these entertainments evolved into theatrical arts which were performed as a type of niwaka (an impromptu comic play) as zenza (a opening act) at vaudeville theaters.
sen.cmt: スペース削除定義の意味と名称を逆に変更
sen.e: Gradually, these entertainments evolved into theatrical arts which were performed as a type of niwaka (an impromptu comic play) as zenza (a opening act) at vaudeville theaters.

sen.j: 2人が正座し簡単な小道具、衣装を身に付け謎かけ問答や知恵比べ問答歌舞伎、芝居の物真似をし人気を取っていた。
sen.e: Two people sitting straight in costumes, played riddles and compare wits with each other, or parodied theatrical plays such as kabuki, and this style of arts became popular.
Sitting straight in costumes, two people played riddles and compared wits with each other, or parodied theatrical plays such as kabuki, and this style of arts became popular.
Sitting straight in costumes, two people played riddles and compared wits with each other, or parodied theatrical plays such as kabuki, and this style of arts became popular.

sen.j: 後に芸として俄から独立。
sen.e: Later, this type of arts separated from niwaka arts and was established as an independent type of art.
Later, this type of arts separated from niwaka arts and was established as an independent type of art.
Later, this type of arts separated from niwaka arts and was established as an independent type of art.

sen.j: 1892年8月に桂梅團治初代・桂家雁篤のコンビが「軽口」の看板を上げ、落語の演目を演じ分けるなど人気を博す。
sen.e: In August, 1892, entertainment shows under the name of "Karukuchi" performed by a duo of Umedanji KATSURA (the first generation) and Gantoku KATSURAYA gained stories of rakugo repertoire.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In August, 1892, entertainment shows under the name of "Karukuchi" performed by a duo of Umedanji KATSURA (the first generation) and Gantoku KATSURAYA gained stories of rakugo repertoire.
In August, 1892, entertainment shows under the name of "Karukuchi" performed by a duo of Umedanji KATSURA (the first generation) and Gantoku KATSURAYA gained stories of rakugo repertoire.

sen.j: その後も桂次郎坊・太郎坊、秋の家稲子・稲八、鶴家團七・團鶴等が人気を博す。
sen.e: Subsequently, karukuchi was performed by popular duos of Jirobo Katsura and Tarobo KATSURA, Ineko AKINOYA and Inehachi AKINOYA, and Danshichi TSURUYA and Dankaku TSURUYA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Subsequently, karukuchi was performed by popular duos of Jirobo KATSURA and Tarobo KATSURA, Ineko AKINOYA and Inehachi AKINOYA, and Danshichi TSURUYA and Dankaku TSURUYA.
Subsequently, karukuchi was performed by popular duos of Jirobo KATSURA and Tarobo KATSURA, Ineko AKINOYA and Inehachi AKINOYA, and Danshichi TSURUYA and Dankaku TSURUYA.

sen.j: その後、音曲万歳、しゃべくり漫才の登場で人気も落ちる。
sen.e: Later, due to arrival of onkyoku-manzai (musical manzai) and shabekuri-manzai, popularity of karukuchi declined.
Later, with the advent of onkyoku-manzai (musical manzai) and shabekuri-manzai, the popularity of karukuchi declined.
sen.cmt: due to arrival of→ with the advent of冠詞
sen.e: Later, with the advent of onkyoku-manzai (musical manzai) and shabekuri-manzai, the popularity of karukuchi declined.

sen.j: 戦後では完全に漫才が主流になり演じ手はいなかったが芦乃家雁玉・林田十郎、松葉家奴・松葉家喜久奴、松鶴家光晴・浮世亭夢若、一輪亭花蝶・松原勝美、浮世亭歌楽・ミナミサザエ等は軽口に近い芸風であった。
sen.e: In the postwar time, although manzai became completely dominant and karukuchi became extinct, manzai dialogues performed by duos of Gangyoku ASHINOYA and Juro HAYASHIDA, Yakko MATSUBAYA and Kikuyakko MATSUBAYA, Kosei SHOKAKUYA and Yumewaka UKIYOTEI, Kacho ICHIRINTEI and Katsumi MATSUBARA and Karaku UKIYOTEI and Sazae MINAMI were close to the style of karukuchi.

In the postwar time, although manzai became completely dominant and karukuchi became extinct, manzai dialogues performed by duos of Gangyoku ASHINOYA and Juro HAYASHIDA, Yakko MATSUBAYA and Kikuyakko MATSUBAYA, Kosei SHOKAKUYA and Yumewaka UKIYOTEI, Kacho ICHIRINTEI and Katsumi MATSUBARA and Karaku UKIYOTEI and Sazae MINAMI were close to the style of karukuchi.

In the postwar time, although manzai became completely dominant and karukuchi became extinct, manzai dialogues performed by duos of Gangyoku ASHINOYA and Juro HAYASHIDA, Yakko MATSUBAYA and Kikuyakko MATSUBAYA, Kosei SHOKAKUYA and Yumewaka UKIYOTEI, Kacho ICHIRINTEI and Katsumi MATSUBARA and Karaku UKIYOTEI and Sazae MINAMI were close to the style of karukuchi.

sen.j: 現在は軽口を継承している芸人はいないが、林家染丸一門や露の五郎兵衛一門が余芸で寄席などで度々披露される。
sen.e: Today, although there is no successor of karukuchi, karukuchi is often performed at vaudeville theaters by Somemaru HAYASHIYA and his pupils and Gorobe TSUYUNO and his pupils.
Today, although there is no successor of karukuchi, karukuchi is often performed at vaudeville theaters by Somemaru HAYASHIYA and his pupils and Gorobe TSUYUNO and his pupils.
Today, although there is no successor of karukuchi, karukuchi is often performed at vaudeville theaters by Somemaru HAYASHIYA and his pupils and Gorobe TSUYUNO and his pupils.

sen.j: 東京の内海桂子は弟子の笑組、ナイツ (お笑いコンビ)と舞台に上がる時、軽口の演目であった『名鳥名木』を演じる。
sen.e: Keiko UTSUMI, a Tokyo-based comedian, also performs one of karukuchi repertoire, called "Meicho Meiboku" when she appears on stage with her pupil comedian duo, Knights.
Keiko UTSUMI, a Tokyo-based comedian, also performs one of karukuchi repertoires, called "Meicho Meiboku" when she appears on stage with her pupil comedian duo, Knights.
